concept.title: Install External Libraries
concept.shortdesc: Install external libraries to make them available to Data Collector stages.

conbody.p:
driversinstalling additional for stagesexternal librariesinstalling additional for stagesthird party librariesinstalling additional for stagesBefore you use the following stages, install JDBC drivers for the implementation that you want to use:
JMS Consumer origin
JDBC Multitable Consumer origin
MySQL Binary Log origin
Oracle CDC Client origin
JDBC Query Consumer origin
JDBC Lookup processor
JDBC Tee processor
JDBC Producer destination
JDBC Query executor
For example, to use the JDBC Query Consumer or the JDBC Producer with Oracle, install the Oracle JDBC drivers.
You can also install external Java libraries to call external Java code from the Groovy, Java, and Jython Evaluator processors.
To install external libraries, complete the following general steps:

ol.li: Set up an external directory to store the libraries.
Use the Package Manager within to install the external libraries.
